data.meta_description: Obituary for Theoris Katwan ("DJ Teddy")  Graham | Theoris Katwan Graham was born in Dade City, Florida on April 19, 1979 to Jane Graham and the late Oscar McKay. Theoris cherished his family and friends and loved...
data.meta_site_name: Theoris Graham Obituary | April 29, 2022 | Milton Funeral Home - Dade City, FL
data.text:
Theoris Katwan Graham was born in Dade City, Florida on April 19, 1979 to Jane Graham and the late Oscar McKay. Theoris cherished his family and friends and loved to laugh. Everyone who knew him, knew how much Theoris loved music. A love that began in his childhood at The Cyprus Manor Apartments and continued throughout his life. As a young man, he nurtured this love by joining the bands while attending Pasco Middle and High Schools. He played the drums in middle school and was Pasco High School's Drum Major. Theoris’ love for music was so great that his career as a deejay began in 1992, when he deejayed a graduation party with the late Leon Bennett for Pasco High’s Class of 1992. After graduating from high school, he became a Pharmacy Technician a position he held for 25 years and continued to deejay until he entered eternity. Theoris was preceded in death by his father Oscar McKay and sister Ramona Jordan. He is survived by: Children - Asyria, Ny’Asiah, Za’Torrai, and Brycen Mother- Jane Graham; Grandmother- Ida Graham; Siblings- Corey Bryant, Latoya Jordan, Shalon Barnett (Jamal), Cedric McKay, Demetrius McKay (Leah), Terry McKay, Quwanna Jackson, Courtney (Master), Ebony Phillips, and Tanisha Grant; Goddaughter-Heaven Mathis; Aunts and Uncles: Sylvester Moorer, Mary Graham, Willie Mae O’Neal, Donna Thomas (Daniel), Loretha Gardner (Arthur), Maria Lee (CJ), Sheri O’Neal, Patricia Brown (Ernest), James McKay (Geneva), Curtis McKay (Kanetha), Wilene Smith (Ernest), Leonard Simmons (Mary), Donald Simmons, Willie O’Neal Bates, Marvis “Nita” Hambrick, Wilma and Frank Pope, Marcelleus Saunders, Josephine Melvin and Eleanor Washington; Special Friends: Christina Vaughns, Clay Womack, Constance Lockridge, Sujith Idiculla, Kendrick Thomas, Brian Thomas, Jesse Coward, Sylvanus Chiaku, Todd Bullard and The Brooksville Elks Lodge; God sisters: Shanika Graves, Tameca Tucker, Senetra Williams, and Jhadha Pye; Theoris is also survived by a host of cousins, other relatives and friends.

2 Corinthians 5:8

We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.
